meanings.sent1: The shodden feet of the hiker were protected by sturdy boots.
meanings.sent2: She always felt comfortable with her shodden feet in her favorite sneakers.
meanings.sent3: The shodden shoes danced happily in the rain puddles.
meanings.sent4: His shodden boots carried him through the muddy fields of the farm.
meanings.sent5: The shodden sandals left imprints in the soft sand along the beach.

meanings.definition: Soaked or saturated with water or another liquid
meanings.sent1: The shodden towel was heavy with absorbed water after the swim.
meanings.sent2: The shodden clothes hung on the line, dripping with rainwater.
meanings.sent3: The shodden sponge eagerly soaked up the spilled juice on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her shodden hair clung to her face after the unexpected downpour.
meanings.sent5: The shodden ground squelched underfoot as they walked through the marsh.
